org.codeoverflow.chatoverflow.api.plugin

Interface Plugin

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PluginImpl

    public interface Plugin
    Plugins do the work of a chat overflow plugin project. They are highly api-version depended. Always check pluggable first!

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getLoopInterval()
      Returns the loop interval, specified by the plugin.
      PluginManager getManager()
      Returns the plugin manager, previously created and set by the framework.
      Requirements getRequirements()
      Returns the requirements of a plugin.
      void loop()
      The loop method is executed in loop with a specified interval until the shutdown method is called.
      void setup()
      The setup method is executed one, when the plugin is started.
      void shutdown()
      The shutdown method should contain logic to close everything.

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        void setup()
        The setup method is executed one, when the plugin is started. Do NOT define your requirements in here!

      • loop

        void loop()
        The loop method is executed in loop with a specified interval until the shutdown method is called. The loop method is NOT executed if a negative loop interval is set.

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        The shutdown method should contain logic to close everything.

      • getLoopInterval

        int getLoopInterval()
        Returns the loop interval, specified by the plugin. A negative interval means, that the loop method is not in use.
        Returns:
        the loop interval in milliseconds

      • getManager

        PluginManager getManager()
        Returns the plugin manager, previously created and set by the framework.
        Returns:
        a instance specific plugin manager object

      • getRequirements

        Requirements getRequirements()
        Returns the requirements of a plugin. These might not be already fulfilled.
        Returns:
        a requirements container, containing requirements :)
